explains: adj. 不适宜居住的（由于天气恶劣或缺乏遮蔽处），条件恶劣的；不好客的，冷淡的

sentences.en: Organizers collected a range of bold, sometimes zany, approaches to the threat of an increasingly inhospitable world.
sentences.cn: 组织者收集了一系列大胆，甚至有时是古怪的，通往越来越不宜居住世界的威胁的方法。

sentences.en: That's probably the most bare, bleak, barren and inhospitable island I've ever seen.
sentences.cn: 那可能是我见过的最光秃、最荒凉、最贫瘠和最不适合居住的岛屿。

sentences.en: This is the time period in which most scientists formerly believed the area to be inhospitable for humans.
sentences.cn: 在这段时间里，大多数科学家曾认为该地区不适合人类居住。
